intro: Filix-mas filix-mas, commonly known as the common horsetail, is a perennial plant belonging to the Equisetaceae family. It is characterized by its jointed, hollow stems covered in sharp, tooth-like structures. The plant produces spore-bearing cones at the top of its stems, which are typically found in moist, shaded environments. Its ancient lineage dates back to the Carboniferous period, making it a living fossil. Filix-mas filix-mas is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils.
